meanings.definition: To sprinkle or adorn with dashes or spots.
meanings.sent1: She decided to bedash her notebook with colorful stickers.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully bedashed the canvas with bright paint.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully bedashed the cake with edible glitter.
meanings.sent4: The night sky was bedashed with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The garden was bedashed with vibrant flowers, creating a beautiful scene.

meanings.sent1: The drummer began to bedash the drums with powerful beats.
meanings.sent2: He watched as the waves bedashed against the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to bedash each other with pillows.
meanings.sent4: The storm bedashed the coast with fierce winds and rain.
meanings.sent5: The boxer continued to bedash his opponent with quick jabs.
